intro: Cystium diphysum, commonly known as the common thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cystium diphysum is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, where it thrives in temperate climates.
